channel.title: How to make a webclient pretty fast
channel.description:
Hey there, here is my super-easy tutorial to get a webclient.
First, download the files from http://uppit.com/v/B0IDMNA2 .
Then, extract the files on ur desktop. So, open up webclient.html and edit the server name wich is set to FiliScape, to your servers name. Then, edit the server IP to your server IP. Third, enter the "Link back to homepage" link, wich is set to http://world2.filiscape.net/ to your own homepage. Fourth, open the Filer_for_FiliScape WebClient folder, and open up the file named A.txt. Search for "FiliScape" and replace it with your server name.
Lastly, you just need to upload the files to any webhost or VPS to host it. If you don't want to use cash on it, i reccomend webs.com. If you have uploaded the files to webs.com, the url for your webclient would be: http://yoursitename.webs.com/webclient.html Note that this tutorial won't let you make or add custom items.

anyone knows how to fix this?

Read full topic

If you have uploaded the files to webs.com, the url for your webclient would be: http://yoursitename.webs.com/webclient.html
Note that this tutorial won’t let you make or add custom items.[/quote]

item.title: How to make a webclient pretty fast
item.dc:creator: @Exotic_Rush Exotic Rush
item.description:
@Exotic_Rush wrote:

If you want to change the IP download CSS DreamWeaver off adobe and open the folder and right click then open with and click DreamWeaver once you have that open at the top click design and click on the java box and click split at the top there you will find <param name="ip" value="IP ADDRESS HERE"> Edit the code and change it to your IP address

if this worked rep me
